messages.message: Hey Team, I have a customer who is looking to change xls documents into json.  I've heard there isn't anything out of the box that would do this, but is there an easy solution for them?
XLS --> PDF --> JSON :stuck_out_tongue: cc @Hari as this might fall under Doc Reader’s purview.
this is a new team working with IB for the first time, so I think they could _probably_ do this outside of IB....would would _love_ if they got their feet wet by using IB for it
Hi @wadams!! We did docx to json for GS.. xls to json is in pipeline but not starting this month.. what is the timeline they are looking for?
@Hari sounds like they want it in a week or so :grimacing:
is there a way to get the desired result out of some python work? (easily)
We analysed xlsx to json for the reader work but it’s a very complex representation... depends on what they need in a week or 2
got it!  followup question: is this specific to xls => json, or is this the same problem if the customer were to want to go csv => json?
Are they looking at simple table structures only? Or do they need us to handle say merged cells, macros etc
(put another way: "would this still be a problem if they wanted to go from csv to json?"
CSV to json is a very simple one
Won’t even take a day, can be outside of the platform with a udf
ah cool!  just so I have that right: csv => json "out of the box" doesn't exist right now, but can be accomplished via UDF?
Yup!! And it’s a very simple task!! csv to json

awesome, thanks, @Hari!  And I got a response to what they want to do with xls, sounds like they want to just do column extraction:
```[
    [column_name_1, column_value_1_for_row_1], [column_name_2, column_value 2_for_row_1],
    [column_name_1, column_value_1_for_row_2], [column_name_2, column_value 2_for_row_2]
]```
Can you get us some samples?
I'll see what I can do, for sure
Cool! Sounds good!!
I have a UDF that does it -- so if you want a cool demo -- can be done quickly. :slightly_smiling_face:

@wadams This should be pretty straightforward with `pandas` alone. So they should be able to do this in any UDF or Python functionality in their own environment. `xls` -> `pandas` Dataframe -> `json`. They would just need to use `pandas.read_excel` and `pandas.to (http://pandas.to)_json`
@andy have you worked with Greg from Gusto before?  (Want to make sure I don't confuse him by elaborating the above :sweat_smile: )
nope, i have not
@Anant i would love to get a demo for them!  Can i scour your calendar and suggest a quick 10-15 with the customer?
sure, anytime
customer stuff -- first priority -- so reach out to @hannah and @Sara Niforatos
yes - pls send me an email with full details pls copying Hannah. thank you!

@wadams we built dev exchange package which converts *xls, xlsx* and *csv* to *json.* This is used by GS team now. Let me know if you want any help regarding this.

Below is the sample flow:
https://instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/gs-india/CSV_XLS_Parser/workflow/excel-multitab.ibflow

Attaching the Screenshots of *input and output*:

`csv_xls_parser` is the dev exchange library name.
Link https://instabase.com/apps/developer-exchange/?app=csv_xls_parser&version=1.0.0
